image.altText: The exterior of the Supreme Court of South Australia.

props.synopsis: A court has ruled the body of a teenager — whose death is being investigated as murder — be cremated against his mother's wishes.

title.children: Court orders murdered teenager be cremated against his mother's wishes

image.altText: An overhead shot of the Whyalla circular jetty

props.synopsis: The Whyalla council sends take-down letters to residents, including admins of a local Facebook group, over social media posts it alleges are defamatory.

title.children: SA council accused of attempt to 'muzzle' residents with legal threats

image.altText: A row of tiny, self-contained homes with timber exterior built around greenery

props.synopsis: A once-empty suburban lot in Adelaide has been transformed into a village of tiny homes to support young people transitioning out of the child and family protection system.

title.children: In this village of tiny homes, young people find their independence

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair in a green and white chequered shirt stands in a row of trees.

props.synopsis: Some members of the SA Country Women's Association have accused the state council of not being inclusive of today's rural women who are juggling the demands of jobs, farms and young families.

title.children: Historic rural institution accused of not reflecting modern women

image.altText: A SA Police officer's shoulder badge.

props.synopsis: A man has been charged with attempted murder after allegedly striking a South Australian police officer with a sword.

title.children: Man charged after police officer allegedly assaulted with sword

image.altText: southern right whales mating in clear, turquoise sea water.

props.synopsis: At opposite ends of the planet, a tale of two whale species has emerged — giving researchers hope and concern in equal measure.

title.children: Southern right whales can live up to 150 years, but others aren't so lucky

image.altText: Two men smile in a workshop-style building.

props.synopsis: It started as a quick job to replace a rotting model boat at the entrance to the town of American River on Kangaroo Island, but it grew into a much bigger project: to build a full-size, operational replica of the sailing ship.

title.children: 'Mad dream' to rebuild 1800s sailing ship

image.altText: composite of banks,, a wanted poster and Kym Parsons over a map of the locations hit

props.synopsis: Over 10 years, the notorious "bicycle bandit" terrorised innocent bank tellers at gunpoint. His identity remained a mystery for almost two decades until police used a game changing forensic technique to unmask the culprit.

title.children: Unmasking the bicycle bandit: How cops caught the notorious armed robber

image.altText: A woman with beige headphones and a tote bag walks past a shop window advertising 50 per cent off.

props.synopsis: Retailers expect shoppers to splurge almost $1.3 billion on Boxing Day itself and $24.7 billion for the entire sales period, which is set to be the biggest on record.

title.children: Boxing Day sales set to break records despite cost-of-living pressures

image.altText: A sign on a fence says 'asbestos'.

props.synopsis: The state's environmental watchdog has charged three companies and one individual with 102 alleged offences related to 26 sites that contained mulch contaminated with asbestos.

title.children: EPA begins prosecutions over asbestos mulch discovery across NSW

image.altText: The exterior of the Supreme Court of South Australia.

props.synopsis: A court has ruled the body of a teenager — whose death is being investigated as murder — be cremated against his mother's wishes.

title.children: Court orders murdered teenager be cremated against his mother's wishes

image.altText: Tsunami monitoring buoy

props.synopsis: Authorities believe the nation is now "much better prepared" to deal with a tsunami than it was two decades ago, but community awareness is low.

title.children: Fears Australians don't understand dangers of tsunamis as risk persists

image.altText: Matt Gaetz stands at a podium and speaks.

props.synopsis: An investigation has uncovered "substantial evidence" that former congressman Matt Gaetz, who Donald Trump had hoped to make US attorney-general, paid for sex with a 17-year-old girl.

title.children: Matt Gaetz paid for sex, including with 17yo girl, Congress committee report alleges

image.altText: Boat surrounded by sharks in blue ocean

props.synopsis: Two mates launched a drone to get a better view of their boat only to find themselves surrounded by more than a dozen sharks. A marine biologist suggests their engine noise was the main attraction.

title.children: Dramatic drone footage shows fishermen's tinnie surrounded by sharks

image.altText: A man looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The S&P 500 and the Nasdaq Composite rose in holiday-thinned trading after a stopgap government funding bill averted a US government shutdown. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: ASX to poised to open lower despite a rally on Wall Street

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: S&P 500, Nasdaq gain in choppy trading as most megacaps move higher
What's going on with our dollar?
Boxing Day sales poised to break records despite cost-of-living pressures

image.altText: Concept art of a sports club.

props.synopsis: A proposed club from Vikings Group with 160 poker machines has been met with criticism from a community group and anti-gambling advocates in the NSW region.

title.children: Proposed club to add 160 poker machines to regional NSW town

image.altText: An illustration of an Afghan man sitting on the floor using a mobile phone.

props.synopsis: Mohammed Sorosh, who is being sought by the Taliban for helping an Australian NGO rescue scores of vulnerable people from Afghanistan, faces a years-long wait before his application for a humanitarian visa will be processed.

title.children: 'Every moment, I am afraid': Calls to prioritise Afghans 'most at risk' for humanitarian visas

image.altText: Max Purcell serves

props.synopsis: Australian doubles star Max Purcell has voluntarily accepted a provisional suspension after admitting to a breach of doping rules in a medical clinic blunder.

title.children: Two-time grand slam doubles champion Max Purcell handed doping ban

image.altText: A tall eucalyptus tree at night covered in fairy lights and a star made of lights at the top.

props.synopsis: When an 80-metre gum tree in the Tasmanian forest was due to be cut down for logging, conservationists turned it into the world's tallest Christmas tree.

title.children: The world's tallest Christmas tree still stands today thanks to activists decorating it 25 years ago

image.altText: A man and woman hug, with six children behind them.

props.synopsis: The former fighter pilot was arrested in 2022 on orders from the United States who accused him of breaching arms trafficking laws by training Chinese pilots in South Africa over a decade ago.

title.children: 'My children are very, very sad': Australian pilot Daniel Duggan to be extradited

image.altText: A view of a subway door from the inside of a dirty train with orange seats on either side and advertising on the walls

props.synopsis: A suspect is in custody after allegedly setting the victim's clothing alight on the subway early on Sunday morning.

title.children: 'Depraved crime': Woman dies after being set on fire in NYC subway

image.altText: Makoto Uchida and Toshihiro Mibe standing alongside each other at white lecterns in front of a white wall with Honda and Nissan

props.synopsis: A potential merger of Honda and Nissan, and its alliance partners Mitsubishi and Renault SA, could create a new manufacturer worth $79.9 billion, producing 8 million cars a year.

title.children: Nissan, Honda announce merger plans to become third-largest car maker

image.altText: A man covered in mud holds turtles

props.synopsis: Col Limpus, 84, has committed most of his life to uncovering mysteries about the majestic sea creatures, including founding the popular Mon Repos Turtle Rookery.

title.children: Champion of turtle conservation retires after six decades

image.altText: A beagle looks up from below a dining room table that has several prepared dishes on it.

props.synopsis: Most pet owners know not to feed their dogs chocolate, but there's a host of other festive foods that can be harmful to animals' health. Two experts offer their advice on the foods to avoid feeding your four-legged friends this festive season.

title.children: The foods to put on the naughty list for your dog this Christmas

image.altText: Pistachios with their hulls split open sit in a red bowl, surrounded by green and red Christmas tinsel

props.synopsis: Australia's pistachio industry has gradually established itself and now with a record harvest, and a new facility, it is looking for new markets overseas.

title.children: Australian pistachios crack a record harvest

image.altText: Two male Aboriginal police liaison officers and a female police officer stand arm in arm.

props.synopsis: As a 20-year-old, Greg Munar broke into the Wadeye police station. Decades later, he’s working there and loving it.

title.children: NT cop's journey from breaking into police station to working there

image.altText: a young man in a hospital bed

props.synopsis: A woman in Taiwan is facing eight years jail after being charged with attempted murder for allegedly poisoning Brisbane university student, Alex Shorey, with rat poison

title.children: Woman charged with attempted murder over Australian student's 2023 poisoning in Taiwan

image.altText: A home destroyed by rocks that fell down a hill in a landslide.

props.synopsis: Vanuatu's deadly magnitude-7.3 earthquake has forced 1,700 people from their homes, with many still sleeping out in the open as weather forecasts predict heavy rain will hit Port Vila.

title.children: Flooding, landslide fears as severe weather stalks earthquake-struck Vanuatu

image.altText: A claymation man, gnome and dog stand outside in front of a large wooden box.

props.synopsis: We first met evil penguin Feathers McGraw in 1993's The Wrong Trousers. Now he's back, seeking revenge on Wallace & Gromit through the spectre of AI.

title.children: The new Wallace & Gromit film gives Mission: Impossible a run for its money

image.altText: An old man wearing a suit and tie speaks into a mic at a podium

props.synopsis: The US president's move comes just weeks before Donald Trump, an outspoken proponent of expanding capital punishment, takes office.

title.children: Joe Biden commutes sentences of most inmates on federal death row

image.altText: A white and orange foxtel branded pad on the ground alongside a green football pitch and empty stadium

props.synopsis: News Corp chief Robert Thomson has heralded the deal as 'a victory for News Corp shareholders, DAZN, and sports fans in Australia and around the world'.

title.children: Foxtel had a pay TV monopoly, now it's been sold to DAZN

image.altText: Two trains at a train station.

props.synopsis: NSW Premier Chris Minns says "nothing is off the table" for New Year's Eve if the government loses a Fair Work Commission case against rail unions over industrial action on Sydney's train network.

title.children: NSW premier says he 'stupidly' agreed to free fares to avoid industrial action and won't do so again

image.altText: The damage from a fatal house fire

props.synopsis: Just three days before Christmas, a child is dead and neighbours are reeling after witnessing a fatal house fire, which one described as "hell on earth".

title.children: Neighbours grieving after house fire kills child just before Christmas

image.altText: A close up of a large crocodile swimming in clear water.

props.synopsis: Burt the crocodile, known for his role in the iconic Australian film Crocodile Dundee, has died at Darwin's Crocosaurus Cove.

title.children: Celebrity crocodile from Crocodile Dundee dies in his 90s
